required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dexmedetomidine Versus Propofol in Conjunction With Regional Block for Shoulder Arthroscopy
clinical_study.official_title: Dexmedetomidine Versus Propofol in Conjunction With Regional Block for Shoulder Arthroscopy: a Randomized Controlled Double Blind Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Operative shoulder arthroscopy under regional block anesthesia often presents with hemodynamic challenges for the anesthesiologist, knowing that a low systolic blood pressure is required to minimize the bleeding. Regional anesthesia is successfully performed to many patients in whom tracheal intubation or the placement of a laryngeal tube is undesired. Propofol has traditionally been used to provide sedation in patients undergoing shoulder arthroscopy under regional anesthesia. In contrast to Propofol, Dexmedetomidine is a highly selective Î±-2 adrenoceptor agonist that has been shown to provide sedation, analgesia and anxiolytic effects with minimal respiratory depression. Due to the effect of both drugs on blood pressure, the investigators set out to compare intraoperative hemodynamics of both drugs, along with the surgeon's satisfaction and the degree of comfort provided to patients undergoing interscalene brachial plexus block for shoulder arthroscopy. The investigators also assessed whether the type of anesthetic agent used for sedation accounted for other differences in intra and post-operative outcome measures.

study_design_info.masking_description: surgeons, patients as well as the outcome assessor were blinded in regards of the drug used for sedation during surgery (Propofol vs dexmedetomidine)

primary_outcome.description: initial Systolic Blood Pressure (iSBP) measurement at arrival to the operating room. Hour 0 is the time of patient's arrival to the operating room.
initial Mean Arterial blood Pressure (iMAP) measurement at arrival to the operating room. Hour 0 is the time of patient's arrival to the operating room.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at 10 minutes interval from the beginning up to 0 minutes after the end of Propofol or Dexmedetomidine infusion
primary_outcome.description: Change in Systolic Blood Pressure from iSBP

primary_outcome.time_frame: at 10 minutes interval from the beginning up to 0 minutes after the end of Propofol or Dexmedetomidine infusion
primary_outcome.description: change in Mean Arterial blood Pressure from iMAP

primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 hour after surgery completion
primary_outcome.description: Global satisfaction of the surgeon regarding anesthesia and patient immobility on a scale from 0 (not satisfied) to 10 (completely satisfied) collected at the end of surgery

primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 hour after surgery completion
primary_outcome.description: Surgeon's evaluation of the bleeding that had affected the surgeon's visibility on a scale from 0 (no bleeding) to 5 (very intense bleeding) collected at the end of surgery

primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 0 minutes after admission to the Post Anesthesia Care Unit (PACU)
primary_outcome.description: number of episodes of hypotension ( a drop of systolic blood pressure >30% of the initial value recorded at patient arrival to the operating theatre)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 10 minutes interval from the beginning up to 0 minutes after the end of Propofol or Dexmedetomidine infusion
at 10 minutes interval from the beginning up to 0 minutes after the end of Propofol or Dexmedetomidine infusion
at 10 minutes interval from the beginning up to 0 minutes after the end of Propofol or Dexmedetomidine infusion
up to 0 minutes after admission to the PACU
secondary_outcome.description: use of vasoactive drugs during surgery (Yes or No)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 3 hours after surgery completion
secondary_outcome.description: use of vasoactive drugs during PACU stay (Yes or No)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 0 minutes after the end of Propofol or Dexmedetomidine infusion
secondary_outcome.description: time to achieve desired Bispectral Index (tBIS) level (minutes)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 3 hours after surgery completion
secondary_outcome.description: Patient Satisfaction 1(PS1): I would want to have the same anesthetic again on a 5 points Likert scale from 0 to 4: 0= Strongly disagree, 1= Disagree, 2= Neither agree nor disagree, 3= Agree, 4= Strongly agree.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 3 hours after surgery completion
secondary_outcome.description: Patient Satisfaction 2(PS2): I felt pain on a 5 points Likert scale from 0 to 4: 0= Strongly disagree, 1= Disagree, 2= Neither agree nor disagree, 3= Agree, 4= Strongly agree.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 3 hours after surgery completion
secondary_outcome.description: Patient Satisfaction 3(PS3): I was satisfied with my anesthetic care on a 5 points Likert scale from 0 to 4: 0= Strongly disagree, 1= Disagree, 2= Neither agree nor disagree, 3= Agree, 4= Strongly agree.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 3 hours after surgery completion
secondary_outcome.description: Patient Satisfaction 4(PS4): I felt relaxed during the procedure on a 5 points Likert scale from 0 to 4: 0= Strongly disagree, 1= Disagree, 2= Neither agree nor disagree, 3= Agree, 4= Strongly agree.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 3 hours after surgery completion
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence of Post Operative Nausea (PON) at PACU at least on episode (yes or No)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 3 hours after surgery completion
secondary_outcome.description: Occurence of Post Operative Vomiting (POV) at PACU at least on episode (yes or No)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 3 hours after surgery completion
secondary_outcome.description: need for rescue analgesia (RA) opioids at PACU (Yes or No)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 3 hours after surgery completion
secondary_outcome.description: time to reach modified Aldrete score of 9/10 at PACU (minutes)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 10 minutes after admission to the PACU
secondary_outcome.description: Visual Analog Scale initial (VASi): Visual analog rating scale for pain (VAS) in which 0 is defined as no pain and 10 as maximum pain at PACU arrival (0-10)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 3 hours after surgery completion
secondary_outcome.description: Visual Analog Scale discharge (VASd): Visual analog rating scale for pain in which 0 is defined as no pain and 10 as maximum pain at PACU discharge (0-10)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 0 minutes after admission to the PACU
secondary_outcome.description: number of episodes of bradycardia (Heart rate <45/min)

other_outcome.time_frame: at 10 minutes interval from the beginning up to 0 minutes after the end of Propofol or Dexmedetomidine infusion
other_outcome.description: Bispectral index (BIS) level value (0-100). BIS is used to monitor depth of anesthesia or sedation.The BIS is an electroencephalogram-derived multivariant scale.The BIS monitor provides a single dimensionless number, which ranges from 0 (equivalent to EEG silence) to 100 (Normal EEG activity or patient completely awake). 0 = EEG silence, [0 to 20] = burst suppression on EEG, [20 to 40] = deep hypnotic state, [40 to 60] = general anesthesia, [60 to 80] = sedation but individual responds to loud commands or mild shaking, [80 to 99] = sedation but individual responds to normal voice and 100 = Completely Awake.

other_outcome.time_frame: at 10 minutes interval from the beginning up to 0 minutes after the end of Propofol or Dexmedetomidine infusion
other_outcome.description: Ramsay sedation scale value (1-6): 1=Anxious, agitated, restless; 2=Cooperative, oriented, tranquil; 3=Responsive to commands only; 4=Brisk response to light glabellar tap or loud auditory stimulus; 5=Sluggish response to light glabellar tap or loud auditory stimulus; 6=No response to light glabellar tap or loud auditory stimulus.

other_outcome.time_frame: up to 0 minutes after the end of Propofol or Dexmedetomidine infusion
other_outcome.description: total duration of Propofol or Dexmedetomidine infusion in minutes

other_outcome.time_frame: up to 0 minutes after the end of Propofol or Dexmedetomidine infusion
other_outcome.description: total dose of Propofol (mg) or Dexmedetomidine (mcg) used

arm_group.description: Patients programmed for elective Shoulder arthroscopy surgery will receive a continuous intravenous infusion of Propofol. Infusion will be started after regional block (interscalene) being performed and will be continued to the end of wound closure. Infusion will be started at 2mg/Kg/h and modified to a maximum of 4 mg/Kg/h in order to achieve a bispectral index (BIS) between 60 and 90 and a Ramsay sedation score between two and four.

Patients programmed for elective Shoulder arthroscopy surgery will receive a continuous intravenous infusion of Dexmedetomidine. Infusion will be started after regional block (interscalene) being performed and will be continued to the end of wound closure. Infusion will be started at 1mcg/kg over 10 minutes then 0.2 mcg/Kg/h and modified to a maximum of 0.7 mcg/Kg/h in order to achieve a bispectral index (BIS) between 60 and 90 and a Ramsay sedation score between two and four with a maximum.

intervention.description: patients in both groups are programmed for an elective shoulder arthroscopy surgery

patients in both groups received regional block for anesthesia: brachial plexus blockade was performed using the interscalene approach under ultrasound combined to nerve stimulation. 20 ml ropivacaine 0.375% were injected.
propofol 10mg/ml was used for sedation as described in the arms section
Dexmedetomidine was diluted to 4mcg/ml and used for sedation as described in the arms section
sedation level was monitored using bispectral index to achieve values described in the arms group

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- American Society of Anesthesiologists score (ASA) I or II.
- Elective Shoulder arthroscopy.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Allergies to any of the used medications.
- ASA score of III or above.
- Cardiac abnormalities.
- Contraindications to regional blocks.
- Patient refusal.

overall_official.last_name: Hicham A ABOU ZEID, M.D., M.Sc.
overall_official.affiliation: Saint Joseph University School of Medicine
Saint Joseph University School of Medicine
